description.narrative: This investment will address a major and persistent shortcoming in the international post-disaster response process. It will introduce a fast start to reconstruction of important social services through the strategic deployment of high quality prefabricated structures within the first six months. These will be permanent disaster resilient buildings. Buildings will be manufactured in part by prefabricated suppliers, delivered by disaster response organisations, constructed by locally engaged workers under professional supervision and quality assured by engineers. This disaster response tool will be demand-driven on a case-by-case basis. The total estimated value of this investment is $1 million to be expensed over 2 years, starting in 2018-19. The 2018-19 pilot, supporting people in Vanuatu displaced by volcanic activity, will demonstrate the quality of the prefabricated buildings and test the model.
